statement: Let \( n \) be a positive integer. Let \( S \) be the set of all pairs \( (h, k) \) of non-negative integers such that \( h + k < n \). Each element of \( S \) is coloured either red or blue, with the property that if \( (h, k) \) is red and \( 0 \leq h' \leq h \), \( 0 \leq k' \leq k \), then \( (h', k') \) is also red. A type 1 subset of \( S \) consists of \( n \) blue elements with distinct first coordinates, and a type 2 subset of \( S \) consists of \( n \) blue elements with distinct second coordinates. Prove that the number of type 1 subsets is equal to the number of type 2 subsets.

Let \( BC \) be a diameter of a circle with centre \( O \). Let \( A \) be a point on the circle such that \( \angle AOC > 60^{\circ} \). Let \( EF \) be the chord which is the perpendicular bisector of \( AO \). Let \( D \) be the midpoint of the minor arc \( AB \). The line through \( O \) parallel to \( AD \) meets \( AC \) at \( J \). Prove that \( J \) is the incenter of triangle \( CEF \).
Find all pairs of integers \( m > 2 \) and \( n > 2 \) such that there exist infinitely many positive integers \( k \) for which \(k^n + k^2 - 1 \mid k^m + k - 1\).

Let the positive divisors of an integer \( n > 1 \) be \( d_1 < d_2 < \ldots < d_k \), where \( d_1 = 1 \) and \( d_k = n \). Define \(d = d_1d_2 + d_2d_3 + \cdots + d_{k-1}d_k\). Prove that \( d < n^2 \) and determine all integers \( n \) for which \( d \mid n^2 \).
Find all real-valued functions \( f \) defined on the real numbers such that \((f(x) + f(y))(f(u) + f(v)) = f(xu - yv) + f(xv + yu)\) for all real numbers \( x, y, u, v \).

Let \( n > 2 \) circles of radius 1 be drawn in the plane in such a way that no line meets more than two of the circles. Their centres are \( O_1, O_2, \ldots, O_n \). Prove that \(\sum_{1 \leq i < j \leq n} \frac{1}{O_iO_j} \leq \frac{(n - 1)\pi}{4}\).
